definition: variant Chinese character
different/other/hetero-/unusual/strange/surprising/to distinguish/to separate/to discriminate
body/form/style/system/substance/to experience/aspect (linguistics)
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: Honestly, this is easier than I expected, though the frequency of archaic and rare words is quite high.
sentences.chinese: 老实说，异体字和生僻字出现的频率比我的预期高。

sentences.english: The proportion of Variants in Shuiwen is high.
sentences.chinese: 异体字在水文中占据很高的比例。

sentences.english: The form is unified and variants are reduced.
sentences.chinese: 字形上统一写法，减少异体字。

sentences.english: Variants in the sense of philology mainly refer to characters capable of replacing each other or variants of Chinese characters.
sentences.chinese: 作为文字学意义上的异文，主要是指通假字和异体字。

sentences.english: There are many variant characters on the Stone Inscriptions of Weijin South and North Dynasties.
sentences.chinese: 魏晋南北朝石刻文献材料中存在大量异体字。

sentences.english: Simplified Chinese characters don't contain any variant forms of these characters.
sentences.chinese: 经过改革后的简化字基本不再使用异体字。

definition: simplified Chinese character
loan character (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/character acquiring meanings by phonetic association/also called phonetic loan
component of a Chinese character (as the radical or the phonetic part)
homophonic characters

nonstandard form of a Chinese character
old character/archaic form of a Chinese character
phono-semantic compound character
phonetic loan character/using one character interchangeably for phonetically related characters
nonstandard form of a Chinese character
phonetic loan character/using one character interchangeably for phonetically related characters
Hanyu Da Zidian, one of the most comprehensive Chinese character dictionaries with 54,678 (and later 60,370) entries, first published between 1986-1990
character with two or more readings
everyday words
